links.title: Regular Expression Matching Can Be Simple And Fast
links.description:
This is a tale of two approaches to regular expression matching.
One of them is in widespread use in the
standard interpreters for many languages, including Perl.
The other is used only in a few places, notably most implementations
of awk and grep.
The two approaches have wildly different
performance characteristics:

links.title: The SO_REUSEPORT socket option
links.description:
One of the features merged in the 3.9 development cycle was TCP and UDP
support for the SO_REUSEPORT socket option; that support was
implemented in a series of patches by Tom Herbert.  The new socket option
allows multiple sockets on the same host to
bind to the same port, and is intended to improve the performance of
multithreaded network server applications running on top of multicore systems.

links.title: How the Bitcoin protocol actually works | DDI
links.description: Many thousands of articles have been written purporting to explain Bitcoin, the online, peer-to-peer currency.  Most of those articles give a hand-wavy account of the underlying cryptographic protocol, omitting many details.  Even those articles which delve deeper often gloss over crucial points.  My aim in this post is to explain the major ideas behind the Bitcoin protocol in a clear, easily comprehensible way.  We’ll start from first principles...

links.title: Why Bloom filters work the way they do | DDI
links.description: Imagine you’re a programmer who is developing a new web browser. There are many malicious sites on the web, and you want your browser to warn users when they attempt to access dangerous sites. links.title: Arduboy FX - Open Source Card-Sized Gaming Board
links.description:
Arduboy FX is an upgraded version from the standard Arduboy that includes a flash memory chip that stores all 250+ Arduboy games on-board! No need to use a PC to switch between games.
Arduboy FX is a miniature game system the size of a credit card. It comes installed with a classic 8-bit game and can be reprogrammed from a library of open source games available online. Arduboy is open source so you can learn to code and create your own games.

links.title: About Ronja
links.description:
Ronja (Reasonable Optical Near Joint Access) is an User Controlled Technology (like
Free Software) project of optical point-to-point data link. The device
has 1.4km range and has stable 10Mbps full duplex data rate. Ronja is an
optoelectronic device you can mount on your house and connect your PC,
home or office network with other networks. Or you can use it as a general
purpose wireless link for building any other networking project.

links.description: A windfall, in personal finance, is defined as a significant amount of money that a person gets unexpectedly. Windfalls can range in magnitude from small additions to an individual's wealth to large fortunes.
